headline: Slow Cooker Chicken Tetrazzini
description: This fork-tender chicken is slow cooked in a thick and creamy sauce seasoned with Italian dressing. Serve with hearty egg noodles to catch every bit.

video.name: How To Make Slow Cooker Chicken Tetrazzini

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Tetrazzini
recipeIngredient: 1 (.7 ounce) package dry Italian-style salad dressing mix
1 small onion, sliced and separated into rings
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken in the slow cooker crock. Top with 2 tablespoons melted butter; sprinkle with Italian dressing mix.
Cover, and cook on High for 3 hours.

Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Mix in the cream of chicken soup, chicken broth, and cream cheese. Pour mixture over the cooked chicken in the slow cooker.
Cover, and continue to cook on Low until chicken in fork tender and the sauce has thickened, about 1 additional hour.

review.reviewBody: This recipe is great! Works well on the stovetop too. This is so easy my 13 year old loves to make it herself! *Note-We do not add butter. I forgot about it the first time I made this and haven't used it since! Thank you!
The chicken shredded after cooking and there wasn't enough liquid.

I was a little worried about how this would turn out because I didn't think it smelled all that great while it was cooking (thanks to Covid, my sense of smell is off). I also discovered that I only had Cream of Mushroom soup, so I used that. It turned out so great. I already wanted to make it again, and I still have some for leftovers for dinner tonight. So yummy!

It's hard to write this review, but I have to. When my mother was suffering from undiagnosed cancer, one of her symptoms was loss of appetite. Nothing really tasted good to her. This was a major exception. Also, my mother was not free with compliments. That's why this recipe is going in our family favorites recipe book. Not only did she like it, she LOVED it and complimented me on it. The first time I made this, I made it exactly as written and it was great. Tonight I am going to make it with leftover Thanksgiving turkey. I will put the cooked turkey in a baking dish and cover with the sauce. It should come out perfectly after about 30 minutes at 350 degrees. After serving it over the pasta, you can sprinkle some grated cheddar on top! Yum!!

So good! I threw the onion and garlic in with the raw chicken to save a step. I also added peas and mushrooms when I added the cream cheese and soup. Served over egg noodles. My husband and I loved it. It will definitely be added to our recipe folder. Thank you!
My husband says this is one of his favorite recipes of all time. I mix the noodles and sauce together in the pot, though. It's so stinkin' easy, too. Love this!

This was a great recipe! I have another recipe from a friend from college, but it is totally different. This one was creamy and tender and had plenty of flavor. I used a crockpot liner and made it exactly to the recipe and it was wonderful! I served it over spaghetti noodles. My husband actually stated we need to “keep this one in the rotation” as he was scraping every last bit off his plate…
This is great as is, only just put all the stuff into the slow cooker at first and add the cream cheese last as others recommended. It is a family hit.

I think maybe it needed more seasoning? This tasted more like cream of chicken soup with a lot of chicken. I served it over egg noodles but it tasted bland and didnt really remind me of a tetrazzini. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't what I was looking for.

It tasted okay. My husband thought it needed something so I added some pepper. After cooking on high for 3 hours then on low for 1 hour the sauce still had not thickened much so I put it back on high for about 30 more minutes and seem to help some. It was very easy to make though. Will probably try it again.

Made a note:
SERVE OVER PASTA!!
Also, I shredded the chicken before adding the soup/cream cheese mixture.

I cooked thick spaghetti al dente and added it to the final hour of slow cooking.
I used my Instant Pot as a slow cooker, dumped the chicken and sauteed the onions and garlic, added the other ingredients, chicken back in, spaghetti in and slow cook for about an hour. Added some Oat Milk and more broth to thin the sauce a little.
1st batch was eaten by 2 very picky eaters who liked it a LOT.
2nd batch I made with breasts AND thighs. I added mushrooms and cooked the chicken with some minced onion in addition to the sauteed onion rings.
This is a solid comfort food.
This recipe was delicious. My family asked me to make it again. I served it over egg noodles. Yummy!
This is so good. I am saving the leftovers to make chicken nachos. Made it just as written. So easy and tasty.
My entire family loved it!!! Definitely going to make it again. Very easy recipe. Absolutely delicious.
Delicious! I added steamed sweet peas into the mix right before serving along w the egg noodles. Absolutely delicious.
Excellent and easy. My family loved it!
My husband loved it. Read some reviews so added a few more Italian spices and broth the last hour with a can of peas. Definitely a go to recipe.

This recipe is super easy and very tasty! I made it as described, but added the following to individual plate for my tastes and to make it taste more like my late mother’s recipe: sage, a little salt and pepper. I also added egg noodles in last 30 minutes of cook time as this was left off of instructions. I added more low sodium chicken broth as needed. Great recipe! Yum! Yum! Thanks!

I didnt have Cream of Chicken soup, so I used Cream of Celery. I also added fresh mushrooms. I found this dish to be a tad salty due to using chicken boullion instead of chicken broth but we really liked this! I am also going to try it with pork. This recipe is a keeper.

So delicious! I didn't have time for a slow cooker meal so I cooked the chicken in my air fryer while I cooked the rest on my stovetop. Then as soon as the chicken was done, I sliced it all up and threw it in the skillet that already had everything else in it for the sauce. Then I made a 1 lb box of penne pasta, drained it and threw that in the big skillet too. All in all it took me less than 30 minutes and it was so freaking delicious! Thank you!
This is a delicious pasta sauce to put on cheese ravioli!
Used to have a bottle of Italian dressing instead of just the seasoning. Added carrots, peas, mushrooms, and cream of mushroom soup. Pretty delicious!
Loved it. Turned out great. Used egg noodles and added a little salt for taste.
This is sooooo good. Make enough for leftovers. I followed recipe to a T except I added mushrooms.
Made just as directed. It was delicious.
Added basil and egg noodles in the last hour. Delicious
I actually added a little shredded carrots and celery. Delicious!!
Add red pepper flakes for more of a kick!
Really easy recipe and soooo good. A really good choice for a weeknight meal for a family....just add a salad or a veggie side dish and your meal is complete!
Easy and delicious

This was amazing! I cooked the chicken in the broth, removed chicken to shred it and poured the broth into a skillet to make the sauce. Added the shredded chicken back to slow cooker and then poured the sauce over top. Also added some steamed broccoli . Everyone had seconds and some had thirds!

Followed the recipe ingredients using frozen chicken and cooking it with everything besides the cream cheese which I added at the end. I also added my veggies of carrots and peas to it so it was a one pot meal. Served over noodles. Flavors were ok but nothing outstanding for me.
I slow cooked it with almost a cup of chicken broth for three hours on low and then I added the rest of the stuff as the recipe Called for and it is pretty good

Deeeeeee-licious!!! End of Story!!! #Yummo

Highly recommend!!
I made it in the instant pot. I set it for 4 minute pressure cook. It tasted great.

This was delicious, and there was A LOT. I'm not really good with making recipes into my own but this recipe leaves a lot of room for additions, to make it your own. I think in my next batch I will use more onions and fresh mushrooms. I also used a bag of shredded mozarella cheese to kind of make everything cheesy and yummy. My family loved this. I put some buffalo sauce on my bowl and ate it like that. I served it with french bread and bruschetta.
love it! I also combine everything with extra broth and cook 8 hours. Family lives it.
My husband liked this.

I loved the taste of this and will make it again. It turned out a little too soupy for my taste, but hey, I'll add more chicken now and see if I can correct for that later. 
 
The finished product was super salty, and that doesn't work for a family member. Next time I'll use lower sodium and salt-free versions of what I can, i.e., unsalted butter and lower sodium cream of chicken soup.

Good recipe, will add to the rotation for sure. Needed a little something though, so we added some red pepper flakes and salt and pepper on serving. Also grated half a cup of sharp cheddar cheese to sprinkle on top.
Very good! We make this like once a month. I use half of the cream cheese with 2 chicken breast.

I followed the other recipes where I added the broth to the chicken initially on low for 4hrs with the Italian seasoning and sautéed the onions and garlic and added the cream of chicken and cream cheese for another hour. I also did add some sliced fresh mushrooms. Great recipe and definitely will make again! I did end up adding more broth which made it a bit soupy but added cornstarch to thicken it up.

This is so very flavorful and easy to make. I did make it on top of the stove and served it over white rice instead of noodles. It was still just as moist and full of chicken flavor. This has become a family favorite. Serve with a fresh garden salad and some crusty Italian bread to complete your meal.

This is so very flavorful and easy to make. I did make it on top of the stove and served it over white rice instead of noodles. It was still just as moist and full of chicken flavor. This has become a family favorite. Serve with a fresh garden salad and some crusty Italian bread to complete your meal.

This was amazing and delicious. I've used very little onion and garlic, since it can be overwhelming at times. I've paired this with Reames's egg noodles. Since I have leftovers, I might eat it alone or do it with pasta next week.
I made it twice, when using the Italian dressing packet, it was too salty. I also made it with Italian seasoning from the spice section of the grocery store, much better!!!!!
lord i love this
We made this as written! Love it.

This recipe is a family favorite! 
I use Ranch dressing instead of Italian, but it tastes great with either!
Serve with egg noodles or rice and steamed veggies. You will not be sorry!!
It was okay but too rich for our tastes. Did not change the recipe. It may have been said before; but the chicken must be shredded after the cooking is done or else it is too watery.

loved it! it was a hit! I threw everything in the crock pot all except the cream cheese. so i used boneless and skinless chicken breast I used a cup of chicken broth, the Italian seasoning, some fresh garlic, onion powder and garlic powder. I used cream of mushroom and cream of chicken and threw it all in the crock pot. cooked it on low for 8 hours. The meat just fell apart. And in the last hour I put a pack of cream cheese and lots of shredded cheese and boiled some noodles. it was awesome! I will make this again!
Easy and delicious. My family ate all of it very quickly! :-) did not change the recipe and served over egg noodles.
This is simply delicious, exactly as is. Will definitely make it again, and will try some variations. Thanks for sharing your recipe :-)
Delicious! It’s so easy, I’ve made it twice already and am making it again this week! I would love mushrooms in it but my husband doesn’t like mushrooms..

I added mushrooms and frozen peas.. and changed the cream of chicken to cream of mushroom. Cooked the mushrooms with the garlic and onions, added all the wet ingredients and added to the crockpot with one hour remaining. Added the frozen peas on top. I also cooked the chicken in chicken broth in the crockpot and not just melted butter. After it was done, I cooked spaghetti, mixed it all together and put it in a baking dish, covered with bread crumbs and melted butter and put in the oven for about 15 mins. Absolutely delicious!!

Very good over rice as well. First, I added the chicken broth to boneless chicken thighs sprinkled with pepper. After 3 hrs. on low, I added the remaining ingredients (I was two ounces short of cream cheese) in addition to carrots, peas, and just a dash of cayenne pepper, for another 1 1/2 hrs. on low heat. Sirracha was served at the table to be added individually to taste (a few drops made this even better!). 
I typically don't rave about crock pot meals, but this was really very good! Thank you for the recipe! Everyone loved it!

Used a little less butter and a little more chicken broth, and added chopped green pepper and some shredded carrots for color. Served with egg noodles...this had great flavor and you can't tell you used the 'cream of ' soup in the sauce.
Went exactly by the recipe, and my husband and I enjoyed it. Will most likely make it again.

My family loved this (including 4 year old). I did not have time to wait on the crock pot so I cooked the chicken in the oven and the sauce on the stove. I did end up adding a little more chicken stock but that was it.
Love this. SO yummy! I added fresh mushrooms when I added the cream cheese. Adding this to my hard copy cookbook!

Definitely a keeper. Threw it together the night before and set the timer on the slow cooker. The wife made wife egg noodles when she got home, tossed a few garlic knots in the oven, and dinner was served. We loved it.
Everyone loved it. Just substituted cream of mushroom instead of the condensed chicken soup.

A very simple dish to put together with tender and creamy results. I didn't have the dry Italian dressing so I added oregano, basil, parsley, paprika, celery salt, herbs de provence, salt and pepper (probably a 1/3 teaspoon of each). I also added frozen peas for the last hour of cooking, then served over linguine. This one is a keeper. Update: This recipe is always in the rotation. I find I can put everything in at once, including raw onions, and even the cream cheese (or save until later if you prefer). I have added extra chicken broth when using this technique and cook on low for 5 - 6 hours. Sooo tender!
Easy and flavorful. I didn't see the directions to add the spaghetti or noodles, but I enjoyed spaghetti with mine. It makes a lot. I might add vegetables to this recipe in the future.
It was really good, and the chicken was so tender! The only thing is, it was very very rich and filling, that we could only have one plate. Very heavy meal, but oh so tasty!

This came out pretty good. I made my own cream base using half and half instead of the canned soup. I doubled the broth and cream cheese. I diced the onions instead of leaving them in rings. I added 3 diced jalapeños and some carrots. Next time I'd probably add peas too. Thanks for the recipe:)
I followed the recipe exactly as stated and it turned out perfect! I will definitely make again.

Delicious! I usually don't rate recipes unless I follow them exactly, but I am going to go ahead with this one since it was a minor change. My change? Only four breasts because that's all I had. As such, I reduced the amount of dried Italian dressing stuff by about a third. I also topped with some fresh parsley and served over fettuccini noodles. The end result was perfect! My three friends and I all agreed that I needed to add this to my list of regulars.

Delicious. Used Italian herb blend instead of dressing mix. Threw everything in the pot this morning except for the cream cheese. Thickened up the sauce with butter and flour. Added cream cheese and some fresh basil at the end. Wow.
So good! My new favorite. I served over rice.
Made this just as directed and everyone loved it!

We love this recipe as a base, but changed the it up a bit. We added extra chicken, pan grilled it and then shredded it. Added Lipton Onion soup instead of the Italian soup mix. Added very finely chopped celery & carrots to the onion. Also added a little sour cream to the mix! Love it by itself with a few fresh baked rolls!
I made this exactly as written. My family loves it. My husband said that it tasted like something out of a restaurant.

This is essentially the same recipe on the website whoneedsacape.com., except she calls it chicken stroganoff. Personally, this recipe, as written, lacks any real depth of flavor. I thought the Italian seasoning packet would add all the flavor necessary, but it isn't enough to stand up to the soup and cream cheese. This is an easy recipe that I intend on making again, but I will most definitely be tweaking the seasonings, in addition to adding a touch more salt. I did not find this recipe at all.

Tip #1. Do not shred the chicken. Doing so will absorb the sauce and it will be very dry for a pasta dish. However, doing so made an amazing chicken salad. Then just add grapes, apples, nuts or whatever and serve on bread.
Made it, but instead of using Italian seasoning I used ranch dressing (dry). It was easy to prepare and it was delicious and I will be making this again!
Followed the directions precisely but this was pretty disgusting.
I'm sorry but my tastes did not like like this at all. I think if the cream cheese was omitted it may have been better.

Amazing. I didn't have an onion so omitted it. Was still an absolutely delicious dish. The chicken shredded beautifully when I added the cream cheese sauce. Cooked the remainder of the hour on low and it was one of the best dishes I've had in a long time.
One of our favorites!

Very good, followed recipe exact for first time and was delicious, next time i will use low sodium ingredients just because I am on a low sodium diet, but did not have a " to much salt" taste at all in my opinion

It was good but we found it needs a little more flavor. It was good but I found I could differentiate the cream of chicken soup too much. Next time I would try to blacken the chicken to give it more flavor.

This was so good! I doubled the sauce ingredients because I wanted leftovers and I'm glad I did. I also added celery, carrots, brussel sprouts, mushrooms and bell peppers. I didn't have a powered dressing packet, so I poured about a cup of italian dressing over the chicken, and threw in an entire stick of butter :-) Instead of putting it over pasta, I cut a spaghetti squash in half (length wise) and put the tetrazzini in the baked squash, sprinkled some cheese on top and baked it just long enough for the cheese to melt. DELICIOUS and very low carbs!! Actually the tetrazinni could be eaten as a soup by itself. It's a keeper!
Just made this and it was delicious!!!!!! My whole family loved it, definately will be cooked more often!
This was so easy & so flavorful!

Followed the instructions pretty closely and it was delicious. Hubby loved it. I hate that it calls for processed ingredients so next time I'll make a homemade cream of chicken soup first. This time I did use Trader Joe's organic low sodium chicken broth which is almost as good as homemade. Thanks!

Hahaha, so I run the risk of writing yet another 'made-it-as-stated-but-here's-my changes' review, but here goes:

First of all, very good, but I did make some changes, one of which was unintentional...I did follow some other reviews that stated cooking all in the crock pot , so that's where I started.

I cut up four huge chicken breasts into thirds, put into the crock pot with about a cup of chicken broth (by day, I'm an exacting chemist, by night, I'm a seat of the pants cook), the Italian seasoning, 2 tablespoons of butter and a half a cup of cooking sherry. Set the crock to high, and after an hour, I added a chopped small sweet onion, the garlic, and here's where I sorta messed up: I added a can of condensed cream of mushroom soup, um, they are right next to each other in the cabinet...since I had a lot of chicken, I added a can of cream of chicken as well, figuring, well, I wonder how this will turn out...

Let that cook on high for about four hours, then turned on low and added the cream cheese and started cooking the wide egg noodles.

The chicken was falling apart tender, the sauce was thick and tasty, I didn't soften the cream cheese enough as there were small chunks in the sauce and that was good thing - a really refreshing taste when you got a chunk in the sauce...

A total keeper and one we will repeat!
This was fantastic. Super easy to make and everyone loved it. I made it with chicken breasts so it was a little dry. I will make again!
It was good, but it needs _something_ not sure what. I added peas and carrots to it. I cooked 4 chicken breasts, and ended up only adding two to the sauce. Served it over spaghetti.
I followed this recipe exactly and it was amazing! Creamy and full of flavor. I mixed in some egg noodles right before serving.

I made this for tonight's dinner and we LOVED it. I used the ingredients as listed except that I used a whole, cut up chicken instead of all breasts because I needed to use it up from the freezer. The night before I mixed all ingredients except onion together in a mixing bowl. I cut up the onion and put it on top and then covered with saran wrap and left in the fridge until morning. In the morning, I skinned the chicken and put it in the crockpot first and covered with the ingredients from my bowl. Oh, I added fresh mushroom too. Turned it on low for 7 hours and went to work (mine has a timer and resets to warm when finished). I removed the chicken from the sauce and shredded with two forks (too hot to handle). With the chicken out, I mixed two tablespoons of corn starch with 2 tablespoons of water and added it to the sauce to let it thicken while I shredded the chicken and cooked the noodles. I served over home made Amish egg noodles (because I saw them in the store and know that I love them). DE-LISH.
Always love this recipe. Please don’t rate it unless you use the Italian dressing mix though...it really does make a huge difference! My family loves this!!
The chicken was so moist. Excellent!
This dish was really good. I added another can of cream chicken with mushroom and black pepper. I also shredded the chicken afterwards. I served it over angel hair pasta. Kids loved it.
Outstanding!!! The only change I made was to use 2 lbs of chicken thighs, instead of breasts. Delicious!!!!

I made this as close to the recipe as possible. I only had bone in chicken thighs. I will definitely make this again but use less of the Italian dressing, too salty for our taste. Thank you for sharing!

This is tasty and easy. I stirred in some steamed broccoli before serving, to give it some color, texture, and extra nutritional value. Was planning to serve the broccoli on the side, but the dish needed some visual appeal. :)
Delicious!
